name: Digital Culture and Data Analytics
descriptions: The Digital Culture and Data Analytics (DCDA) program prepares students to work at the intersection of technology, culture, and data. Students develop skills in coding, statistics, multimedia authoring, and digital analysis.

courses: Intro: ENGL 20813, WRIT 20303, WRIT 20323, or WRIT 20333
Multimedia Authoring: WRIT 40163, WRIT 40263, WRIT 40363, WRIT 40463, WRIT 40563, CRWT 30363, STCO 36403, or EDUC 50263
Capstone: DCDA 40833 (offered each Spring) or DCDA 40003

electiveCourses.description: One Digital Culture elective (3 hrs) + One Data Analytics elective (3 hrs) + Four general electives from approved list (12 hrs)

internship.description: DCDA 40273 - DCDA Internship (3 hrs). Students apply digital culture and data analytics skills in a professional setting. The internship can count as either a Digital Culture or Data Analytics elective.
